definition[0]: to divide land, a company etc into smaller parts and share it between people – used especially to show disapproval
example[0]: The Ottoman Empire was carved up by Britain and France after World War I.
example[1]: The two companies are attempting to carve up a large slice of America’s publishing industry between them.
definition[1]: to drive past a car and then suddenly move in front of it so that you are too close
definition[2]: an arrangement between two or more people, governments etc by which they divide something among themselves even though this is wrong
